decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

PA-937-200 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); PA-937-201 dated August 2024  (Proposed First Floor Plan); PA-937-202 dated August 2024 (Proposed Second Floor Plan); PA-937-203 dated August 2024 (Proposed Third Floor Plan); PA-937-204 (Proposed Fourth Floor Plan); PA-937-206 (Proposed Roof Plan); PA-937-210 (Proposed South Elevation); PA-937-212 (Proposed North Elevation); PA-937-213 (Proposed East Elevation); PL-1079-MB-00-105 (Existing / Proposed - General Approach), PA/937/001, PA/937/002, PA/937/220, PA/937/221, PA/937/230, 67-75 Broadway: Daylight and Sunlight Assessment for Planning; Design & Access Statement; Noise Impact Assessment (ref. 17651.NIA.01); Travel Plan (ref. 18003).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials shall be in accordance with the materials described in the Application Form and Approved Plans as listed in Condition 2 of this decision.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Construction Method Plan approved under Ref: 233501CND dated 16.11.2023.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Prior to the first occupation of the additional hotel rooms hereby approved, details on the provision of a minimum of two (2) secure long-term cycle storage spaces to be provided in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan (2016) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved long-term cycle storage spaces shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the additional hotel rooms and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | A minimum of three (3) existing hotel rooms shall be converted to be wheelchair accessible in accordance with Figure 52, incorporating either Figure 30 or 33, of British Standard BS8300-2:2018. Such provision shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the additional hotel rooms and retained permanently.

REASON: To ensure the provision of wheelchair accessible accommodation in line with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021); and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The refuse and recycling storage show on dwg. PA/937/200 of the Approved Plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the additional hotel rooms hereby approved and retained permanently.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies SI8 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with, in accordance with policies D14 and SI1  of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment / extraction / ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications) and the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, the proposed additional hotel rooms (Use Class C1) shall only be used for the purposes of a use falling within Use Class C1 (Hotels and Hostels) and not for any other use without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To ensure that the Local Planning Authority retains control over the nature of the use in the interests of the appropriateness of alternative uses, amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties, vitality and viability of the surrounding area, highway safety and the impact on the local highway network in accordance with policies D3, D4 and T6 of the London Plan (2021); 3.7 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
-	ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
-	Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report PLG05, Brightness of Illuminated advertisements, 2015.
-	CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003.
-	Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra.

REASON: To provide a safe and secure external environment and to safeguard the amenities of future occupiers of the development and surrounding properties in accordance with policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), as well as, the Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 8: Safer Ealing. | Prior to the first occupation of the additional hotel rooms hereby approved, details of a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to bedrooms on the Broadway, West Ealing fa√ßade with the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall thereafter be permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by air pollution, in accordance with policies D14 and SI1  of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | No part of any roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 of the London Plan (2021); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The bottom half of the proposed windows in the south facing elevation of the development approved shall contain only obscured glass and shall be permanently fixed shut and be implemented prior to the first use of the development, and shall be thereafter permanently retained and maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 of the London Plan (2021); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73.a) to vary conditions 2 and 6 of planning permission ref: 182956FUL dated 20/03/2020 for: Third and fourth floor level side extensions to provide twenty-seven addition hotel rooms; installation of single air conditioning unit at roof level; alteration to rear fenestration of building involving installation of door to refuse store; and associated cycle and waste storage spaces. Amendment seeks to relocated three wheelchair accessible rooms from the approved extensions to the existing building
